title: Webnotes: a simple replacement for comments, pingbacks, and webmentions

title: The Hacking of Culture and the Creation of Socio-Technical Debt
summary: Culture is increasingly mediated through algorithms.  These algorithms have splintered the organization of culture, a result of states and tech companies vying for influence over mass audiences.  One byproduct of this splintering is a shift from imperfect but broad cultural narratives to a proliferation of niche groups, who are defined by ideology or aesthetics instead of nationality or geography...
